dillon.gameEngine.core

Class Core

  • java.lang.Object
    • dillon.gameEngine.core.Core

  • public class Core
extends java.lang.Object
    Core file that has starting and stopping methods. A policy file should be used to isolate the game to a certain directory.
    Author:
    Dillon - Github dg092099

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public static void startGame(int FPS,
             java.awt.Image background,
             int mode)
        This method starts the game with the specified background and fps.
        Parameters:
        FPS - The maximum frames per second to use.
        background - The default background image. Use CanvasController.setBackgroundImage(Image img) to change it.
        mode - This sets the rendering mode.

      • getBackColor

        public static java.awt.Color getBackColor()

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        This returns the title you specified for the game.
        Returns:
        Name

      • getIcon

        public java.awt.Image getIcon()
        This returns the icon on the taskbar that you requested to be used.
        Returns:
        taskbar icon

      • setup

        public static void setup(int width,
         int height,
         java.lang.String title,
         java.awt.Image icon)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method sets up the jframe.
        Parameters:
        width - width of jframe.
        height - height of jframe.
        title - title of game.
        icon - Icon to use in the corner of the program - optional, the engine has its own, but it's ugly so use your own.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Results because the icon that you specified couldn't be found.

      • setFullScreen

        public static void setFullScreen(boolean b)
        Sets if the screen should be fullscreen.
        Parameters:
        b - Weather or not it should be fullscreen.

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth()
        Returns jframe width
        Returns:
        width

      • getHeight

        public static int getHeight()
        Returns jframe height
        Returns:
        height

      • getController

        public static CanvasController getController()
        Gets the canvas
        Returns:
        canvas

      • crash

        public static void crash(java.lang.Exception e)
        This method shuts off the event system and activates CanvasController's Crash to stop the engine.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception that was thrown.

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown(boolean hard)
        This method will shutdown the game. This occurs when the x is clicked, the key combination shift + escape is used, or the game crashes.
        Parameters:
        hard - Determines if the api would yield to the event system for shutdown, or if it will shutdown directly.

      • setFPS

        public static void setFPS(int fps)
        This method sets the maximum frames per second that this game should run on.
        Parameters:
        fps - The new fps limit.

      • setBackColor

        public static void setBackColor(java.awt.Color c)
        This method will change the color of the background on the game.
        Parameters:
        c - The new color.

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        This function will return the current version of the engine.
        Returns:
        Version string
